projects.name: Portfolio Website
projects.blurb: This website! The source code and commit history can be found on my GitHub.

projects.name: Chess Engine
projects.blurb: In my free time, I'm developing a chess engine with C++. Due to the rapidly growing number of positions that the computer has to evaluate, the key problem is optimisation.

projects.name: Manual Transmission
projects.blurb: During the first project of mech 223, I designed a two-speed manual transmission. This project required extensive use of SolidWorks and rapid prototyping techniques.

projects.name: Mission Planner
projects.blurb: My primary project on the ubc Subbots software team is developing a 'mission planner' which coordinates the autonomous underwater vehicle's (auv's) actions.

projects.name: Unity Video Game
projects.blurb: As a hobby project, I developed a short video game in Unity. This provided a space to experiment with both real-time physics simulations, and logic-based object interactions.

projects.name: Metal-Cast Key
projects.blurb: As a gift to a friend, I designed, moulded, and casted a metal key. This was a good test of my metalworking skills, and taught me about the casting and heat-treating process.

projects.name: Chess Board
projects.blurb: As a birthday present to my grandfather, I hand-made a chess board using woodworking techniques I developed in my gcse Design and Technology course.

projects.name: Kitchen Organiser
projects.blurb: For my final project in my gcse Design and Technology course, I designed, modelled, and built a kitchen organiser. I practiced my design, prototyping, and woodworking skills.
